Package org.pepstock.charba.client

Class Chart

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pepstock.charba.client.Chart
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IsJSType
    @JsType(isNative=true,
        name="Chart",
        namespace="<global>")
public final class Chart
extends Object
implements IsJSType
    Native object which import the CHART java script object of CHART.JS.
    The Chart the entry point of CHART.JS.
    Author:
    Andrea "Stock" Stocchero

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor Description
      protected Chart​(Context2dItem context, NativeObject configuration)
      Builds CHART object at CHART.JS level.
      This constructor MUST be empty.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      (package private) void clear()
      Will clear the chart canvas.
      Used extensively internally between animation frames.
      (package private) void destroy()
      Use this to destroy any chart instances that are created.
      This will clean up any references stored to the chart object within Chart.js, along with any associated event listeners attached by Chart.js.
      (package private) void draw()
      Triggers a redraw of all chart elements.
      It just clears the canvas and draws all the elements again, without doing layout and other stuff.
      (package private) ArrayObject getActiveElements()
      Returns the active (hovered) elements for the chart.
      (package private) double getAspectRatio()
      Returns the aspect ratio.
      String getCharbaId()
      Returns the CHARBA ID, set to the chart.
      IsChart getChart()
      Returns the CHARBA chart or null if CHARBA id is not present in the CAHRT.JS chart options.
      (package private) NativeObject getChartArea()
      Returns the chart area node, as native object.
      (package private) double getCurrentDevicePixelRatio()
      Returns the current device pixel ratio.
      (package private) NativeObject getDatasetMeta​(int index)
      Looks for the dataset that matches the current index.
      (package private) boolean getDataVisibility​(int index)
      Returns the stored visibility state of an data index for all datasets.
      (package private) static NativeObject getDefaults()
      Returns the defaults property by native object.
      (package private) ArrayObject getElementsAtEventForMode​(NativeBaseEvent event, String mode, NativeObject options, boolean useFinalPosition)
      Looks for the element under the event point, then returns all elements at the same data index.
      Calling it on your chart instance passing an argument of an event, will return the point elements that are at that the same position of that event.
      (package private) int getHeight()
      Returns the height in pixel.
      (package private) static NativeHelpers getHelpers()
      Returns the helpers property by native object.
      (package private) int getId()
      Returns the CHART JS chart ID.
      static ArrayChart getInstances()
      Returns the instances property by native object.
      (package private) static NativeObject getInteraction()
      Returns the interaction property by native object.
      (package private) NativeObject getLegend()
      Returns the legend node, as native object.
      (package private) NativeObject getOptions()
      Returns the options node, as native object.
      (package private) static NativeObject getOverrides()
      Returns the overrides property by native object.
      (package private) NativeObject getScales()
      Returns the scales node, as native object.
      (package private) ArrayObject getSortedVisibleDatasetMetas()
      Returns an array of all the dataset meta's in the order that they are drawn on the canvas that are not hidden.
      (package private) NativeObject getSubtitle()
      Returns the subtitle node, as native object.
      (package private) NativeObject getTitleBlock()
      Returns the title node, as native object.
      (package private) NativeObject getTooltip()
      Returns the tooltip node, as native object.
      (package private) int getVisibleDatasetCount()
      Gets the amount of datasets which are visible
      (package private) int getWidth()
      Returns the width in pixel.
      (package private) void hide​(int datasetIndex)
      Sets the visibility for the given dataset to false.
      Updates the chart and animates the dataset with 'hide' mode.
      This animation can be configured under the hide key in animation options.
      (package private) void hide​(int datasetIndex, int dataIndex)
      Sets the hidden flag of that element index to true and updates the chart.
      (package private) boolean isDatasetVisible​(int index)
      Gets if the dataset is visible or not, selected by index.
      (package private) boolean isPluginEnabled​(String pluginId)
      Check if a plugin with the specific ID is registered and enabled.
      (package private) void render()
      Triggers a redraw of all chart elements.
      Note, this does not update elements for new data.
      (package private) void reset()
      Reset the chart to it's state before the initial animation.
      A new animation can then be triggered using update.
      (package private) void resize()
      Use this to manually resize the canvas element.
      This is run each time the canvas container is resized, but can be called this method manually if you change the size of the canvas nodes container element.
      (package private) void resize​(int width, int height)
      Use this to manually resize the canvas element.
      This is run each time the canvas container is resized, but can be called this method manually if you change the size of the canvas nodes container element.
      (package private) void setActiveElements​(ArrayObject elements)
      Sets the active (hovered) elements for the chart.
      (package private) void setDatasetVisibility​(int datasetIndex, boolean visibility)
      Sets the visibility for a given dataset.
      This can be used to build a chart legend in HTML.
      During click on one of the HTML items, you can call it to change the appropriate dataset.
      (package private) void setOptions​(NativeObject newOptions)
      Sets new options node, as native object, for updating a existing chart.
      (package private) void show​(int datasetIndex)
      Sets the visibility for the given dataset to true.
      Updates the chart and animates the dataset with 'show' mode.
      This animation can be configured under the show key in animation options.
      (package private) void show​(int datasetIndex, int dataIndex)
      Sets the hidden flag of that element index to false and updates the chart.
      (package private) void stop()
      Use this to stop any current animation loop.
      (package private) String toBase64Image​(String type, double encoderOptions)
      Returns a base 64 encoded string of the chart in it's current state.
      (package private) void toggleDataVisibility​(int index)
      Toggles the visibility of an item in all datasets.
      A dataset needs to explicitly support this feature for it to have an effect.
      From internal chart types, doughnut / pie and polar area use this.
      (package private) void update()
      Triggers an update of the chart.
      This can be safely called after updating the data object.
      This will update all scales, legends, and then re-render the chart.
      (package private) void update​(String mode)
      Triggers an update of the chart.
      This can be safely called after updating the data object.
      This will update all scales, legends, and then re-render the chart.
      A animation mode key can be provided for the update process using a specific animation configuration.
      This is useful when update is manually called inside an event handler and some different animation is desired.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Chart

        protected Chart​(Context2dItem context,
                NativeObject configuration)
        Builds CHART object at CHART.JS level.
        This constructor MUST be empty.
        Parameters:
        context - represents a flat cartesian surface whose origin (0,0) is at the top left corner, with the coordinate space having x values increasing when going right, and y values increasing when going down.
        configuration - configuration of CHART (native object).

      • resize

        @JsMethod
void resize()
        Use this to manually resize the canvas element.
        This is run each time the canvas container is resized, but can be called this method manually if you change the size of the canvas nodes container element.

      • resize

        @JsMethod
void resize​(int width,
            int height)
        Use this to manually resize the canvas element.
        This is run each time the canvas container is resized, but can be called this method manually if you change the size of the canvas nodes container element.
        Parameters:
        width - width size of resize
        height - height size of resize

      • update

        @JsMethod
void update()
        Triggers an update of the chart.
        This can be safely called after updating the data object.
        This will update all scales, legends, and then re-render the chart.

      • update

        @JsMethod
void update​(String mode)
        Triggers an update of the chart.
        This can be safely called after updating the data object.
        This will update all scales, legends, and then re-render the chart.
        A animation mode key can be provided for the update process using a specific animation configuration.
        This is useful when update is manually called inside an event handler and some different animation is desired.
        Parameters:
        mode - an animation mode can be provided to indicate what should be updated and what animation configuration should be used

      • render

        @JsMethod
void render()
        Triggers a redraw of all chart elements.
        Note, this does not update elements for new data. Use .update() in that case.

      • draw

        @JsMethod
void draw()
        Triggers a redraw of all chart elements.
        It just clears the canvas and draws all the elements again, without doing layout and other stuff.

      • destroy

        @JsMethod
void destroy()
        Use this to destroy any chart instances that are created.
        This will clean up any references stored to the chart object within Chart.js, along with any associated event listeners attached by Chart.js.

      • stop

        @JsMethod
void stop()
        Use this to stop any current animation loop.
        This will pause the chart during any current animation frame. Call .render() to re-animate.

      • clear

        @JsMethod
void clear()
        Will clear the chart canvas.
        Used extensively internally between animation frames.

      • reset

        @JsMethod
void reset()
        Reset the chart to it's state before the initial animation.
        A new animation can then be triggered using update.

      • toBase64Image

        @JsMethod
String toBase64Image​(String type,
                     double encoderOptions)
        Returns a base 64 encoded string of the chart in it's current state.
        Parameters:
        type - indicating the image format
        encoderOptions - between 0 and 1 indicating the image quality to use for image formats that use lossy compression.
        If this argument is anything else, the default value for image quality is used. The default value is 0.92.
        Returns:
        base 64 image

      • getElementsAtEventForMode

        @JsMethod
ArrayObject getElementsAtEventForMode​(NativeBaseEvent event,
                                      String mode,
                                      NativeObject options,
                                      boolean useFinalPosition)
        Looks for the element under the event point, then returns all elements at the same data index.
        Calling it on your chart instance passing an argument of an event, will return the point elements that are at that the same position of that event.
        Parameters:
        event - event of chart.
        mode - interaction mode to use
        options - interaction options which is an object as following:
        interface IInteractionOptions { axis?: string; intersect?: boolean; }
        useFinalPosition - if true, defines the interpolation to get the elements that will be in the event position when current animations are completed.
        When false, elements are considered at their current position.
        Returns:
        all elements at the same data index, as array of native object.
        It is an object as following:
        interface InteractionItem { element: Element; datasetIndex: number; index: number; }

      • getSortedVisibleDatasetMetas

        @JsMethod
ArrayObject getSortedVisibleDatasetMetas()
        Returns an array of all the dataset meta's in the order that they are drawn on the canvas that are not hidden.
        Returns:
        an array of all the dataset meta's in the order that they are drawn on the canvas that are not hidden.

        @JsMethod
NativeObject getDatasetMeta​(int index)
        Looks for the dataset that matches the current index.
        Parameters:
        index - dataset index
        Returns:
        dataset item, as native object

      • isDatasetVisible

        @JsMethod
boolean isDatasetVisible​(int index)
        Gets if the dataset is visible or not, selected by index.
        Parameters:
        index - dataset index
        Returns:
        true if dataset is visible otherwise false.

      • getVisibleDatasetCount

        @JsMethod
int getVisibleDatasetCount()

        Returns:
        the amount of datasets which are visible

      • setDatasetVisibility

        @JsMethod
void setDatasetVisibility​(int datasetIndex,
                          boolean visibility)
        Sets the visibility for a given dataset.
        This can be used to build a chart legend in HTML.
        During click on one of the HTML items, you can call it to change the appropriate dataset.
        Parameters:
        datasetIndex - dataset index
        visibility - if true enables the visibility otherwise false

      • toggleDataVisibility

        @JsMethod
void toggleDataVisibility​(int index)
        Toggles the visibility of an item in all datasets.
        A dataset needs to explicitly support this feature for it to have an effect.
        From internal chart types, doughnut / pie and polar area use this.
        Parameters:
        index - data index

      • getDataVisibility

        @JsMethod
boolean getDataVisibility​(int index)
        Returns the stored visibility state of an data index for all datasets.
        Parameters:
        index - data index
        Returns:
        true if the data item is visible

      • hide

        @JsMethod
void hide​(int datasetIndex)
        Sets the visibility for the given dataset to false.
        Updates the chart and animates the dataset with 'hide' mode.
        This animation can be configured under the hide key in animation options.
        Parameters:
        datasetIndex - dataset index

void hide​(int datasetIndex,
          int dataIndex)

        datasetIndex - dataset index
        dataIndex - data index
